SENT.plain: The minichromosome maintenance (Mcm) and Cdc6 proteins are important regulators of eucaryotic DNA replication
In most normal tissues, a similar proportion of cells express Mcm-2 and Ki-67
The present study showed that in both normal and abnormal states, the proportion of megakaryocytes expressing Mcm-2 is roughly seven times as many as those that express Ki-67
This is likely to be related to the process of endomitosis and endoreduplication
We also demonstrated that a significantly lower proportion of megakaryocytes in myelodysplastic syndrome express Mcm-2
These findings provide new insights into megakaryocyte biology
